segments.text: I notice the boy stretching to reach the cookie jar, barely balancing on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is right there, waiting for him to hand her a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re both going to end up falling if they’re not careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to collapse under him, and the floor is already wet from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t turned around to see what they’re doing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she even knows the sink is overflowing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but I don’t know if they’d listen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope no one gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
